message.content:
cs.CV, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.RO, cs.NE 

This paper is about computer vision, specifically optical flow estimation using deep learning. Therefore, the most likely category is cs.CV (Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition). The paper also discusses the use of unsupervised learning, which suggests that it may belong to the sub-category of cs.LG (Machine Learning). Additionally, the paper uses classical energy-based optical flow methods, which could fall under the sub-category of cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence). The use of bidirectional flow estimation and occlusion-awareness suggests that the paper may also belong to the sub-category of cs.RO (Robotics). Finally, the paper discusses the use of synthetic datasets for supervision, which could fall under the sub-category of cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing).
